page.title: 10THE WEST PIER.
page.content: The West Pier wasdesigned by Eusebius Birch and was opened on the 6th October 1866.It was a bare structure lacking any buildings other than kiosks, and a pavilion which was added in 1893 for theatre and dance. The West Pier had a long history but in 1969 an application was made to the Department of the Environment suggesting the demolition of the unsafe structure.The prospect of losing one of Brighton's most famous landmarks caused enormous public outcry, despite the cost of replacing the seaward end of the pier being over Â£650,000.Brighton Council were only able to offer Â£300,000.Following this the pier went on sale to the public for the princely sum of Â£1 in l978 with the proviso of carrying out the escalating Â£2 million worth of work. As yet there are no purchasers!
